text: Anyone know how to add an H1 to a blog listing page?

That’s kind of a broad question, can you provide some context? Are you  pulling the H1 from a post or are you just trying to get the blog’s title? or are you intending to actually hardcode in an h1 into the template

Sure! I'm not pulling the H1 from a post. I'm missing an H1 on every topic and author page on the blog subdomain, and I'm wondering if adding an H1 to the blog listing page will solve this problem. I'm simply wanting to hardcode "[Company Name] Blog" as the H1.

Hope that makes sense!

ahh, then yes that will do what you want. you just need to edit the blog template and add your h1 where you need it, it will then show up on both listing and post detail pages (your author and topic listings as well)
Perfect. Do you have an example or link you can share with me? There's so much code in that listing template, it's kind of daunting knowing where to add the H1.
You’re going to have to paste the code you have and probably link to the page so we know what it looks like. The code on every HS site is different(unless using a common theme)
Thanks, man! I just figured it out. SO helpful!
well hopefully in a week we’ll hear “guess what? SMART CONTENT IN CUSTOM MODULES”
I just spend the entire day adding custom fields to a form module, only to realize I couldn't make it smart... shoulda searched here first, lol

For some reason a rich text field will not show up in this code output. Super frustrating! I don’t see anything wrong with this code, and the background-color variable shows up fine. Did anyone else have this bug?
Here’s another clue. The code snippet for the group looks like this. I’m not sure why the second one looks like it does with all the extra code.
That should be fine, I would wrap the rich text in a span so you don’t get weird floating characters in the WYSIWYG
You made sure that you have content in the field?
One thing I would try is to add like 5 different items in that repeater. I had a bug one time where my fields weren’t appearing if I only had one item in the repeater
